about_the_game:
NUN is a third-person cinematics and dialogue-driven open-world adventure game, with action and RPG elements and a 1970s horror/exploitation/grindhouse aesthetic. In the year 1820, Sister Mary-Martin, a newly-initiated Templar Knight, is sent on a mission to the land of Winchester to investigate the mysterious disappearance of a young nun.

KEY FEATURES:

The Immersive 3D World of Winchester. As Sister Mary-Martin, explore a large open world with scores of characters and locations. Interact with unique characters and items, and engage in combat with various manifestations of evil on your way to Winchester Village and its lurid history of witch trials.

A Retro-Horror Movie Game. Featuring a retro B-movie aesthetic, the main goal of NUN is to progress the narrative through cinematic cutscenes that pay homage to 1970s grindhouse/horror/exploitation films.

Unlock an Ever-Widening Conspiracy. Search for answers throughout rural Winchester County by completing quests, engaging in spirited conversation with a host of NPCs, and pursuing justice deep, deep into the heart of the Valley of the Shadow of Death!

content_descriptors.notes: BLOOD AND GORE, INTENSE VIOLENCE, SEXUAL THEMES, USE OF DRUGS AND ALCOHOL, LANGUAGE
